timeline.bodyText: The AnnotatedTypeMirror parameters are only used to decide if isSubtypeTypeVariable should be called instead of isSubtype(AnnotatedTypeMirror, AnnotatedTypeMirror).  This is true for the other AnnotatedTypeMirrors parameters in this method and the method below.
timeline.author: smillst
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -396,14 +399,19 @@ public static boolean canHaveEmptyAnnotationSet(AnnotatedTypeMirror type) { } /** - * Tests whether {@code subAnno} is a sub-qualifier of {@code superAnno}, according to the type - * qualifier hierarchy. This checks only the qualifiers, not the Java type. + * Tests whether {@code subAnno} is a sub-qualifier of, or equal to, {@code superAnno}, + * according to the type qualifier hierarchy. This checks only the qualifiers, not the Java + * type. * *

This method takes an annotated type to decide if the type variable version of the method * should be invoked, or if the normal version is sufficient (which provides more strict * checks). * - * @return true iff {@code subAnno} is a sub qualifier of {@code superAnno} + * @param subType the type that might be a subtype
